Eric Schmidt summed up the seismic shift at Google's helm in a Twitter post last week that said, Day-to-day adult supervision no longer needed! Eric Schmidt has led Google since 2001, three years before the company went public. Since then, Google's shares have grown more than sixfold, at one point surpassing$ 700. No Second Thoughts Speaking in an interview with Diane Sawyer of ABC News earlier this week, Donald Rumsfeld put it this way: What you know today can help you unthink your thinking about tomorrow. It can't help you with things you were thinking about back then, he said. "Back then, there was reasonable confidence that[ Saddam Hussein ] had these weapons." No state needs to declare bankruptcy, Bill Lockyer said, "The states have sovereign taxing power the big companies don't."
